alert.note: Alert for Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 3:53PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHWESTERN UNION AND NORTHEASTERN COLFAX COUNTIES THROUGH 430 PM MDT... At 353 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Trinchera to Raton Crews Airport. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Raton, Folsom, Sugarite and Raton Crews Airport. This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between Mile Markers 437 and 457. Highway 64 between Mile Markers 332 and 373. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor your preferred media outlets and NOAA Weather Radio for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Far Northeast Highlands; Johnson and Bartlett Mesas Including Raton Pass
